answers.answer: Wow...you sound pretty messed up.My advice to you is to take care of yourself first,then contact a lawyer.It sounds like you may have a malpractice case here,if you can prove that all this was the direct result of this bozo's incompetence.Then he drops you as a patient on top of it all? He probably did you a favor...Hope all goes well and let us know what happens!I feel for you,I really do..HUGZNY

I do not concur!  Get your diabetes under control first.  Are you severely overweight?  Was the implanted stint one with an antibiotic coating?Are you drinking caffeinated coffee or soda's?  If so, you need to stop.Lithotripsy could easily cause the stint to move so I'd suggest that you get over any kind of "malpractice" idea.  If you didn't get the stone(s) removed, I'll guarantee you'll wish you'd died!Was the physician a board-certified urologist?You need to get back to somekind of specialist, diabetes or urologist.  Make a list of your symptoms in order of severity ... make sure the sleeplessness is on there (ask for some ambien to get you over some of the sleepless nights).I'm sure you can get it treated, just be patient and firm.  If you're not clicking with one physician, ask for a referral to another.  None of us get alone with everyone and all well-trained physicians recognize that.-Good luck-Bill

question: I am a 40 year old woman that also has diabetes.  In may they found kidney stones.  In June they put a stint in my urinary track.  In July they did a lipotripsy on my kidney.  Before they did they took an x-ray and found that my first stint had fallen.  So durring the lipotripsy they replaced it.  A few days later I ended up in the e.r. with severe pain.  The next day I went to see my uroligist and made him remove the stint due to all the pain.  Which in turn he dropped me as a patient.  But since he has removed this  I still have bouts with severe pain.  I can no longer since his removal of the stint hold my urine at all. And have also kept an ongoing UTI.  I went to e.r. again last night due to the pain.  They ran a test on my urine and said that i have a severe UTI and that my white blood count is in the 400's in my urine.  What would cause this?  Is there a chance that when he took out the stint that he harmed me in some way.  I never had any of these problems before the surgery.  Not to mention that since the time of them removing the stint.  I urinate about every 15 minutes day and night.  I have been going on about 2 hours worth of sleep a night since July.  Please try to help with some answers
title: Need answers sick of run around
